name: Parador Arcos de la Frontera

reviews.title: Wonderful!!
reviews.text: Everything about our stay was wonderful! The rooms were clean, nicely furnished, and comfortable. The staff was friendly and accomodating (and gave great restaurant recommendations). The grounds were well maintained and there is a beautiful view of the ocean (past the pool and lush green lawn). I would recommend this hotel without any reservations!

We made sure we had a balcony room to enjoy the fantastic cliffside view. The room was large and very comfortable. The staff was very pleasant. The hotel has free parking out front which is a rare commodity in the old clifftop section of Arcos. They'll even let you double park if you are at the hotel and move the car for you if needed. Be warned though the streets at the top getting to the Parador are very, very narrow (flip in your sideview mirrors at some points) and it can be a bit nerve wracking, especially for Americans used to a bit more room on their roads. The last night we gave up and parked in a pay lot at the bottom of the hill and walked up. For such a nice hotel the room rates are reasonble. Breakfast while good, was fairly expensive.
reviews.title: nice hotel, challenging to get to

reviews.text: The white knuckle drive straight up a mountain is quickly forgotten once you open the shudders and take in the eye-popping views from this cliffside parador. While the rooms and the public facilities are average at best, the sweeping views of southern Spain make this parador a must when in the Jerez area.
reviews.title: It's About the View

reviews.text: We stayed two nights in Room 15, which has an exceptional view from the private deck, the bedroom and the bathroom. Taking a shower in the morning with windows open to the maginficent view, my wife remarked that she could hear the roosters crowing in the yard of one of the houses far below. The pigeons and swallows bolted through the skies right outside our windows, taking advantage of the (sometimes fierce) winds that seemed a constant part of our stay.
reviews.title: Quality and style

reviews.text: The room was comfortable and adequate, but certainly nothing special. Likewise, the restaurant was good, even if the menu is rather limited and the service dis-spirited. Getting up to the parador by car is a real challenge and not for the faint of heart. The trick seems to be to drive with authority and to never actually stop moving. Remember to tuck in your side view mirrors or you WILL lose them. These streets, if they can be called streets, define steep and narrow. Parking is a nightmare. In our case, when we arrived we were told to double park behind another vehicle and to leave our keys with the front desk. During the night, one of the clerks moved the car into a parking spot when it became available.
reviews.title: Great views, quiet hotel

description: The cultural crossbreeding of the Casa del Corregidor displays an andalusian character, with latticework and a courtyard. Many of the rooms overlook a splendid landscape filled with art, nature and history. The flowery tiling enlivers the wood of the furniture and the ochre of the terraces.
